msContents.summary: A Karaim translation of the Torah and the Haftarah

ab.title: Deuteronomy 1
ab.l: These are the words which Moses spoke to all Israel at the ford of Jordan in the wilderness, in the steppe opposite Suph, between Paran and Tophel and Laban and Hazeroth and Di-Zahab.
It was eleven days’ journey from Horeb by the way of Mount Seir to Kadesh-Barnea.
And it was in the fortieth year, in the eleventh month, on the first day of the month: Moses spoke to the children of Israel everything that the Lord had commanded through him to them.
After he had slain Sihon, king of the Amorites, who dwelt in Heshbon, |and| Og, king of Bashan, who dwelt at Ashtaroth at Edrei,
At the ford of Jordan, in the land of Moab, Moses decided to explain this Law, saying,
‘The Lord our God spoke to us in Horeb, saying, “You have had enough of staying at this mountain.

Turn and set out and come to the mountain of the Amorites, and to all their neighbours, in the steppe, in the hills, and in the lowland, and in the south, and by the sea shore, to the land of the Canaanites and to Lebanon, to the great
river, the river Euphrates.
See: I have set the land before you. Come and inherit the land which the Lord swore to your fathers, to Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, to give to them and to their offspring after them.”
And I spoke to you at that time, saying, “I am not able to carry you myself alone.
The Lord your God has multiplied you, and, lo, you are today as the stars of heaven for multitude.

May the Lord, God of your fathers, add on to you a thousand times so many more
than you are and bless you, as he has promised you!
How can I myself alone carry your stress and your burden and your strife?

Take you wise men, and rational, and known,
according to your tribes , and I will set them superiors over you.”
Two verses are missing here.
And you answer ed me, and said, “The word which you have spoken is good to do.”

And I took the superiors of your tribes, wise men, and known, and set them superiors over you , superiors of thousands and superiors of hundreds and superiors of fifties and superiors of tens and overseers for your tribes.
And I directed your judges at that time, saying, “Hear between your brothers and judge righteously between every man and his brother and between the stranger.

You shall not favour in judgment, you shall hear the small as well as the great. You shall not be afraid before of man, because the judgment is God’s. And the
word that is too hard for you to understand it: bring it forward to me, and I will hear it.”
And I commanded you at that time all the words which you should do.
And we set out from Horeb, we walked in all that great and awesome wilderness which you saw by the way of the mountain of the Amorites, as the Lord our God commanded us, and we came to Kadesh-Barnea.
And I said to you, “You have come to the mountain of the Amorites, which the Lord our God gave to us.
See: the Lord your God has set the land before you. Go up and inherit it, as the Lord God of your fathers has said to you. Do not fear and do not be broken down.”

And you came near to me, every one of you, and said, “We will send men before us, and they shall spy for us out the land, and bring us back a word of answer of the way by which we will go up and of the cities to which we will come.”
And the thing seemed good in my eyes, and I took twelve men of you, one of each tribe.
And they turned and went up to the mountain and came to |the valley of| the river of Eshcol and spied it out.

And they took of the fruit of the land in their hands and brought it down to us, and brought us a word of answer again, and said,
“It is a good land which the Lord our God does give us.”
But you did not want to go up, and you rebelled against the command of the Lord your God.
And you quarrelled in your tents, and said, “Because of the Lord’s despise he has brought us out from the land of Egypt, to give us to the hand of the Amorites, to destroy us.

Where are we going? Our brethren have melted our heart, saying, “The people are greater and taller than we, the cities are walled and reach the heavens, and we even saw the children of the Anakim there.””
Then I said to you, “Do not be broken down and do not fear them.
The Lord your God who goes before you: he will fight for you according to all that he did with you in Egypt in your sight,
And in the wilderness, where you have seen that the Lord your God carried you, like a man carries his son, all the way that you walked until you came to this place.”
And in this thing you do not trust the Lord your God,
Who went in the way before you to spy you out a place to camp, in fire by night to show you the way you should go, and in a cloud by day.
And the Lord heard the sound of your words and was angry and swore, saying,

Not a man among these men, this evil generation, will see
the good land that I swore to give to your fathers,
Just Caleb, son of Jephunneh: he shall see it, and I will give the land that he has trodden on to him and to his children, because he has followed the Lord’s order fully.”
The Lord was angry with me, too, because of you, saying, “You, too, shall not go there.

Joshua,
son of Nun , who stands before you, he will go there. Strengthen him, because he will cause Israel to divide it.
And your infants whom you said will be a prey, and your children who do not know today good and bad, they will go there, and I will give it to them, and they shall inherit it.
But you: turn and set out to the wilderness by the way of the Red Sea.”

And you answered and said to me, “We have sinned against the Lord, we will go and fight, according to all that the Lord our God commanded us.” And you each girded your weapons of war, you made an agreement to go up to the mountain.
And the Lord said to me, “Say to them, “You shall not go up, you shall not fight, because my help is not among you, so you will not be defeated before your enemies.””
And I spoke to you, and you did not listen but rebelled against the command of the Lord your God, and you intrigued and went up to the mountain.

And
the Amorites, who dwelt in that mountain, came out against you, and chased you, as bees do, and crushed you in Seir, as far as Hormah.
And you returned and wept before the Lord, but the Lord did not listen to your voice and did not give ear to you.
And you stayed in Kadesh many days — as many days as you stayed in other encampments.
